channel.title: Associations, libraries and companies specialised in accessibility services on EDRLab members
channel.description: Recent content in Associations, libraries and companies specialised in accessibility services on EDRLab members

item.title: Association Valentin Haüy
item.description: for the last 130 years, the AVH has offered multiple services to people with reading disabilities.

item.title: Bibliothèque Sonore Romande
item.description: a non-profit organisation which provides audiobooks to people with reading disabilities.

item.title: CELA
item.description: The Centre for Equitable Library Access is a national non-profit organisation established by Canadian public libraries to champion the fundamental right of Canadians with print disabilities to access media and reading materials in the format of their choice.

item.title: Fondazione LIA
item.description: the LIA Foundation promotes books and reading in all its traditional and digital forms, through education, information, awareness-raising and research activities, guaranteeing the fundamental principles: accessibility , integration and sociality.

item.title: Mobidys
item.description: adapts ebooks to the needs of dyslexic people, using its FROG EPUB extension.

item.title: National Network for Equitable Library Service (NNELS)
item.description: the National Network for Equitable Library Service NNELS is a repository of content owned and sustained by Canadian public libraries.

item.title: NLB
item.description: the Norwegian Library of Talking Books and Braille (NLB) produces and lends out talking books and braille books.

item.title: Nota
item.description: Nota is an institution under the Ministry of Culture of Denmark, which makes printed text available in digital formats.
